resources.string: Destroy the enemy\'s flagship to claim victory. Be sure to defend your own flagship, or be prepared to suffer defeat.
Both you and your enemy will fight to the last ship. Annihilate the entire enemy force to claim victory.

RESOURCE COLLECTOR:
 hit points: 1000
 damage: 0
 cost: 10000
 The resource collector is a small-size ship with no weaponry. It collects resources from the
 nearest asteroid and delivers them to the flagship. It has a maximum resource storage of 2500.

SCOUT:
 hit points: 1000
 damage: 0
 cost: 3000
 The scout is a small-size, very fast ship with no weaponry. Equipped with a large sensor radius,
 the scout visits asteroid clusters in search of the enemy. If enemies are found, the scout maintains
 sensor range for as long as possible and relays the enemy position to the flagship via the
 minimap.

FIGHTER:
 hit points: 3000
 damage: 100 x 2
 cost: 5000
 The fighter is a small-size, fast ship equipped with two forward-facing guns. Although it is
 somewhat weak on its own, the fighter can be formidable in groups.

BOMBER:
 hit points: 3000
 damage: 225 x 2
 cost: 7000
 The bomber is a small ship equipped with two forward-facing missile launchers. Although
 slower and less maneuverable than the fighters, the bomber compensates with higher firepower.

LASER CRUISER:
 hit points: 7500
 damage: 800 x 2
 cost: 19000
 The laser cruiser is a medium-size ship equipped with two forward-facing laser emitters. Its high
 firepower makes it a dangerous threat despite its lower hit points.

BATTLESHIP:
 hit points: 20000
 damage: 150 x 2 (guns), 300 x 2 (missile launchers)
 cost: 35000
 The battleship is a large-size ship equipped with two forward-facing guns and two side-facing
 missile launchers. One battleship has the strength to match a fleet of ships, and its varied
 weaponry gives it the ability to engage multiple enemies simultaneously.

FLAGSHIP:
 hit points: 30000
 damage: 150 x 4
 cost: N/A
 The flagship is a large-size ship equipped with four forward-facing guns. The flagship is both the
 fleet commander and ship builder, so a great priority should be placed on defending the flagship.
 In classic mode, losing the flagship means game over.

SPACE STATION:
 hit points: 40000
 damage: 0
 cost: 50000
 The space station is an large-size immobile ship that can hold small ships within. Ships docked
 within the space station are repaired to full hit points.
RECTANGLE FORMATION:\n Consists of 1-2 horizontal rows of ships. Large and medium ships take position in\n the middle, and small ships take position on the outside.
V FORMATION:\n Consists of one inverted V shape. Small ships move to the front rows, and medium\n and large ships move to the back rows.
CIRCLE FORMATION:\n Consists of one large circle shape. Small ships move to the front of the circle, and\n medium and large ships move to the back of the circle.
CUSTOM FORMATION:\n Creates a formation in the shape of the ships that are currently selected.
RESOURCES:\n The flagship uses resources to build ships. Resources deplete as ships are constructed.
SENSORS:\n Each ship has its own limited sensor radius, which is seen as a gray ring when ships are selected. Sensors allow ships to see enemy ships.

STAR MAP:\n The star map displays the locations of all visible ships. Blue ships will appear as green dots. Enemies that are within sensor range will appear as red dots. Enemies that were once visible but have since moved out of sensor range will have their last known position appear as a magenta dot.

BLACK HOLE:\n If selected as a parameter, a black hole will appear at the centre of the star map. Its strong gravitational pull affects everything nearby. Beware, as large ships are especially susceptible and will be pulled in fast. A slingshot maneuver around the black hole is not encouraged!

MOVE BUTTON: 
 Press the move button, then press a location on the screen to move the selected ships(s)
 to that location. Pressing the move button twice will open the star map. Pressing a
 location on the star map will move the selected ship(s) to that location.
STOP BUTTON: \n Press the stop button to halt the movement of the selected ship(s). For scouts and\n resource collectors, this will stop their automatic scouting and resource collecting duties.
TARGET BUTTON: \n Press the target button, then select an enemy ship for the selected ship to attack.
AUTO ATTACK BUTTON: \n Pressing the auto attack button toggles auto attack on (red) and off (yellow). Ships with\n auto attack toggled on will automatically target and attack the closest enemy ship.
VIEW BUTTON: \n Press the view button to centre the screen on the selected ship(s).
SALVAGE BUTTON: \n Pressing the salvage button will destroy the selected ship(s). An amount of resources\n proportional to the original cost and remaining health will be returned.
MENU BUTTON: \n Press the menu button to toggle between normal and special menu.
DOCK BUTTON: \n Pressing the dock button will make the selected ships(s) dock at the nearest space station if eligible.
DOCKED SHIPS MENU BUTTON: \n If a space station is selected, pressing the docked ships menu button will open the docked ships menu.
RESOURCE COLLECTOR BUTTON: \n If a resource collector is selected, pressing the resource collector button will toggle the ship to begin collecting resources and delivering resources to the flagship.
AUTO SCOUT BUTTON: \n If a scout is selected, pressing the auto scout button will toggle the ship to begin searching for enemies.
BACK BUTTON: \n Press this button to access the normal and special menus.
NEXT FORMATION BUTTON: \n Pressing the next formation button will rotate through the available formations, selecting the\n ships and centering the screen on the formation.
DISBAND FORMATION BUTTON: \n If a formation is selected, pressing the disband formation button will remove the ships from the\n formation.
